alert.note: Alert for Crockett (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:18PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Crockett County through 800 PM CDT... At 716 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a couple of strong thunderstorms in southern Crockett County. One storm was 10 miles north of Pandale and the other storm was 15 miles northwest of Juno. The storms were moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Crockett County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for west central Texas.
